page.title: 12CORPORATION PARK
page.content: The park was publicly opened on the{ {22nd October, 1857.}The land was bought for the Council by Mr T.Dugdale and expenditure by the Corporation was Â£17,086 16 shillings. It was built in order to give work to the Irish unemployed. The park is landscaped around a steep_sided valley. Immediately inside, the fine entrance arch is flanked by a charmingly designed Garden of Remembrance associated with the two World Wars. It is open to the public on every day of the year, and has 14 tennis courts, 3 bowling greens, a childrens playground, an aviary and 2 lakes with ornamental water fowl. The larger lake in the park was originally a reservoir known as Pemberton Clough which supplied the town through wooden pipes. The park receives up to 100,000 visitors each year.
